did.unittitle: Leroy Y. Beaujon Railroad Collection

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Payroll vouchers and correspondence pertaining to the Central New England Railway, the Philadelphia, Reading & New England Railroad, and the Hartford and Connecticut Western Railroad. Also includes public and employee timetables of the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad, western region.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Hartford and Connecticut Western Railroad was formed in 1881 from the remnants of the bankrupt Connecticut Western Railroad, which was formed in 1868 and ran from Hartford, Connecticut, into Litchfield County, Connecticut, and on to Pine Plains, New York. After 1881 the H&CW purchased the Rhinebeck & Connecticut Railroad to extend the line to Rhinecliff, New York. In 1889 the H&CW was absorbed into the Central New England & Western Railroad, which was created after a bridge was built over the Hudson River at Poughkeepsie, New York, to facilitate coal freight and passenger traffic from Pennsylvania and eastern New York into southern New England. In 1892 the CNE&WRR was purchased by the Philadelphia & Reading Railroad to become the Philadelphia, Reading & New England Railroad.

In 1898 the Philadelphia, Reading & New England Railroad became the Central New England Railway. In 1900 a branch line was formed from Tariffville, Connecticut, to Agawam Junction, Massachusetts. In 1904 the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad purchased control of the CNE in order to obtain the Poughkeepsie Bridge, but the CNE was operated as an independent company until it was totally absorbed by the NYNH&HRR in 1927.

Leroy Y. Beaujon was born in 1929 in Canaan, Connecticut, and worked for the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad from 1947 to 1957 (excepting the years he served in the U.S. Army from 1953 to 1956) in station and tower service. He started working in the travel industry in 1957 and moved to California in 1973, where he currently resides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Leroy Y. Beaujon Railroad Collection consists of payroll vouchers and paychecks, correspondence, a scrapbook, and photographs related to the Central New England Railway ( CNE) and its predecessor companies, including the Philadelphia, Reading & New England Railroad and the Hartford and Connecticut Western Railroad. The Central New England Railway, which ran from eastern New York through western and parts of central Connecticut and into southern Massachusetts, was absorbed by the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad in 1927. Also included is a scrapbook of newspaper clippings, documents, and photographs with information about the Housatonic Railroad and the Canaan, Connecticut, railroad station, which was the victim of arson in 2001. These materials were gathered by Mr. Beaujon, a historian of the railroad lines of western Connecticut.

The collection also includes 483 public timetables, from 1892 to 1968, from the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad of the western region of the system ("Lines West"), with one timetable, from 1969, of Penn Central, New Haven Division. Also includes are 143 employee timetables, from 1915 to 1969, of the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad's western division, which included the former Central New England Railway lines.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to New England railroads. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Leroy Y. Beaujon Collection. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Photographic negatives in the collection are primarily scenes of stations along CNE. The list is arranged by the number which appears on the sleeve for each negative. In some cases the same number has been made part of the negative itself. Additional information, sometimes penciled on the sleeve, is summarized in the column called "other". The rail line is given since some of the negatives pertain to geographic areas not under the umbrella of the CNE or one of its predecessor lines. Occasionally "New Haven" has been used interchangeably with "CNE" (see numbers 8047 and 8048 for example). In order to assure that information contained in this list matches the notations on the sleeves, no attempt has been made to revise conflicting comments.

Letter to John Brock, President of the Philadelphia, Reading & New England Railroad, from E. C. M. Rand of the Poughkeepsie & Eastern Railway, March 1, 1898. Rand asks Brock if he will let him know the status of the reorganization of the Philadelphia, Reading & New England Railroad; Rand wishes to connect to the line when it is reorganized,

Connecticut Western Railroad, two items: " Connecticut Western Railroad, its feasibility and importance to Hartford," printed in 1868 (photocopy); "An Act Incorporating the Connecticut Western Railroad Company," (photocopy),

Sullivan, about a switch that hadn't been moved and prevented a Newburgh, Dutchess & Connecticut Railroad train to move; "Sixth Annual Report of the President and Directors of the Hartford & Connecticut Western Railroad to the Stockholders to be submitted at their Annual Meeting in the City of Hartford, on Tuesday, December 10, 1887," (typescript copy); "Statement of Facts by the Hartford & Connecticut Western R.R. Co. in support of their Petition for Charter to Extend their Road to Springfield," (typescript),
